raw_text:
Musical treatment for Capra film
 
 The classic film It's A Wonderful Life is to be turned into a musical by the producer of the controversial hit show Jerry Springer - The Opera.
 
 Frank Capra's 1946 movie starring James Stewart, is being turned into a £7m musical by producer Jon Thoday. He is working with Steve Brown, who wrote the award-winning musical Spend Spend Spend. A spokeswoman said the plans were in the "very early stages", with no cast, opening date or theatre announced.
 
 A series of workshops have been held in London, and on Wednesday a cast of singers unveiled the musical to a select group of potential investors. Mr Thoday said the idea of turning the film into a musical had been an ambition of his for almost 20 years. It's a Wonderful Life was based on a short story, The Greatest Gift, by Philip van Doren Stern. Mr Thoday managed to buy the rights to the story from Van Doren Stern's family in 1999, following Mr Brown's success with Spend Spend Spend. He later secured the film rights from Paramount, enabling them to use the title It's A Wonderful Life.
llama3.2:1b: A musical adaptation of Frank Capra's 1946 film "It's A Wonderful Life" is being produced by Jon Thoday, working with Steve Brown and his musical Spend Spend Spend. The project has been in development for several years, including workshops in London where a cast of singers unveiled the concept to potential investors on Wednesday.
llama3.2:3b: It's a Wonderful Life is being turned into a musical by Jon Thoday and Steve Brown, producers of Jerry Springer - The Opera. The project, valued at £7m, has been in development for nearly 20 years.
gemma2:2b: A musical version of the classic film "It's a Wonderful Life" is being developed by producer Jon Thoday, who worked with composer Steve Brown on the award-winning show "Spend Spend Spend." The project is in early stages with no cast or specific opening date, but workshops have been held.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The classic film "It's a Wonderful Life" is about to be turned into a musical by Jerry Springer - The Opera producer Jon Thoday. They are working with Steve Brown, who wrote Spend Spend Spend. In London and on Wednesday, a cast of singers unveiled the musical to potential investors. A series of workshops were held in London, and a select group of potential investors were present at their unveiling.
qwen2.5:1.5b: The classic Capra film "It's A Wonderful Life" is being adapted into a musical by producer Jon Thoday and writer Steve Brown, based on Philip van Doren Stern's short story The Greatest Gift, with plans in development for cast, opening date, and venue.
qwen2.5:3b: The classic 1946 Frank Capra film "It's a Wonderful Life" is being adapted into a £7m musical by producer Jon Thoday, who also created successful shows like "Spend Spend Spend". Steve Brown worked on that show and wrote the musical score for this project. Plans are in the early stages without cast or venue details, but workshops have been held in London including an unveiling to potential investors. The story originated as a short story called "The Greatest Gift" by Philip van Doren Stern, which Thoday acquired from Van Doren Stern's family in 1999, and secured film rights for the title "It's a Wonderful Life".
opencoder:1.5b:
Musical treatment for Capra film

The classic film "It's A Wonderful Life" is turned into a £7m musical by producer Jon Thoday. A company has been working with Steve Brown to create the music and it’s an ambitious idea from his own 20 years of film-making and commercial success. The work was based on a short story and, following Van Doren Stern's purchase, secured rights to the film in 1999.
smollm:1.7b:
The musical treatment for Capra film is a project that aims to transform the classic film into a musical by the producer of the popular show Jerry Springer - The Opera. The director of the musical, Frank Capra, has been working with Steve Brown, who wrote the award-winning musical Spend Spend Spend. A spokeswoman said the plans were in the "very early stages", with no cast, opening date or theatre announced.

A series of workshops have been held in London and on Wednesday a cast of singers unveiled the musical to a select group of potential investors. The idea of turning the film into a musical had been an ambition of Mr Thoday for almost 20 years. It's a Wonderful Life was based on a short story, The Greatest Gift, by Philip van Doren Stern. Mr Thoday managed to buy the rights to the story from Van Doren Stern's family in 1999, following Mr Brown's success with Spend Spend. He later secured the film rights from Paramount, enabling them to use the title It's a Wonderful Life.

First, I'll read through the original text carefully. It talks about two things: one is about turning a classic film into a musical for a show called "The Opera" based on the controversial show by producer Jon Thoday. The other part mentions that Frank Capra's movie was turned into a £7 million musical with Steve Brown, who wrote a winning play called Spend Spend Spend.

I notice that both involve Frank Capra and Jon Thoday working together. They're using the same name for the film but different names for the project—It's A Wonderful Life for the movie and The Opera for the show. The production is in London, and they've held workshops, with a cast opening for investors.

I should make sure to include key points: the transformation from a movie to a musical, the names involved, the budget, the collaboration between Capra and Thoday, and some about the film itself by Philip van Doren. It's important to mention that Thoday bought the rights in 1999 after Brown's success.

I also need to keep it concise, so I'll focus on the main transformations—changing the title from a movie to a show, the collaborative effort between Capra and Thoday, the budget of £7 million, the collaboration with Spend Spend Spend for the play, and the financial aspect of the project.

The classic film "It's A Wonderful Life" is being transformed into a £7 million musical under the banner of producer Jon Thoday, collaborating with Frank Capra. This project is inspired by the controversial show "The Opera." The collaboration was made possible after Steve Brown wrote and directed a winning play titled "Spend Spend Spend," which was adapted into the £7 million film. Frank Capra's 1946 movie was bought rights from Philip van Doren Stern in 1999, allowing Paramount to use its title under the new project. Thoday's initiative has been a long-term ambition of his, and the production is set in London with workshops held before revealing the musical to investors.
tinyllama:1.1b: The classic movie "It's A Wonderful Life" is being adapted into a musical by producer Jon Thoday for the stage. The film starred James Stewart, and Thodawey has worked with Steven Brown on the musical production, which is in the early stages of development. Potential investors attended a series of workshops, where a cast of singers unveiled the project to a select group. The musical has been in the works for nearly two decades and will likely feature original songs from Brown's previous musical "Spend Spend Spend." As the producer and composer of the hit "Jerry Springer - The Opera," Thodawey is well-known for his collaborations with entertainment industry veterans. No official cast or release date has been announced, but interested parties are encouraged to follow the project on social media for updates.

This exciting collaboration aims to bring the timeless story of George Bailey to life on stage. However, details of the production are still under wraps with no casting announced or opening date confirmed. The concept of turning the film into a musical has been an ambition of Mr. Thoday for almost 20 years.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Producer Jon Thoday plans a £7 million musical adaptation of Frank Capra's 1946 classic "It's A Wonderful Life," starring James Stewart. The project, in its early stages, is being developed with Steve Brown, the writer of the award-winning "Spend Spend Spend." Thoday has held workshops in London and recently unveiled the concept to potential investors. He's had an enduring interest in this musical idea for nearly two decades. The story is based on Philip van Doren Stern's short tale, "The Greatest Gift," of which Thoday acquired the rights from Stern's family in 1999. Subsequently, he secured film rights from Paramount, allowing for the title "It's A Wonderful Life."
